page.title: 17 The Cantern Brook
page.content: The{Cantern Brook}is a{stream}in Bridgnorth that leads to the{River {Severn.}The stream starts from a {freshwater spring}by{Rhodes Farm}where {dams}have been built to form{Trout {Pools. Further down the stream is{Kingsley {Farm}where the fields were once {flooded}for{watercress plantations}and {water}is still{pumped}for{animals}& {crops. Next is{Hook Farm}where the stream is important for{Hereford Cattle}in {summer months.}The stream is{wooded}at {both sides}of its{steep}sided valley. In the{shallow}parts May Fly larvae and Freshwater Shrimps are found. Stone Loach,Bullhead,Stickleback,Water Beetles,Water Scorpion and Caddis Fly larvae are found in the{deeper}parts. After passing the old{sewage works the{Brook}joins the{River Severn.
